questions.question: Who was the first Black woman to win an Academy Award?
questions.explanation: Hattie McDaniel won the Oscar for Best Supporting Actress in 1940 for her role in 'Gone with the Wind', becoming the first Black American to win an Academy Award.

questions.question: The 'I Have a Dream' speech was delivered during which event?
questions.explanation: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his iconic 'I Have a Dream' speech during the March on Washington on August 28, 1963.

questions.question: What did Madam C.J. Walker become famous for?
options: Becoming the first female self-made millionaire in America
questions.explanation: Madam C.J. Walker (Sarah Breedlove) created a line of hair care products and built a business empire, becoming the first female self-made millionaire in America.

questions.question: Which city is considered the birthplace of jazz music?
questions.explanation: New Orleans is widely recognized as the birthplace of jazz, where it emerged in the early 20th century from a blend of African and European musical traditions.

questions.question: Who wrote the autobiography 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'?
questions.explanation: Maya Angelou wrote this powerful autobiography in 1969, detailing her early years and the challenges she faced growing up as a Black woman in America.

questions.question: The Tuskegee Airmen were the first Black military aviators in which branch?
questions.explanation: The Tuskegee Airmen were the first Black military aviators in the U.S. Army Air Corps during World War II, overcoming discrimination to become highly decorated pilots.

questions.question: What did Carter G. Woodson create that later became Black History Month?
questions.explanation: Carter G. Woodson, known as the 'Father of Black History,' created Negro History Week in 1926, which was later expanded to Black History Month in 1976.

questions.question: Which Black inventor created an improved filament for the light bulb?
questions.explanation: Lewis Latimer worked with Thomas Edison and invented an improved carbon filament that made light bulbs more practical and longer-lasting.

questions.question: The Black Panther Party was founded in which year?
questions.explanation: The Black Panther Party was founded in Oakland, California in 1966 by Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale.

questions.question: Who was the first Black woman in space?
questions.explanation: Mae C. Jemison became the first Black woman in space when she flew aboard the Space Shuttle Endeavour in September 1992.

questions.question: What was the name of the first major Black newspaper in America?
questions.explanation: Freedom's Journal, founded in 1827 by John Russwurm and Samuel Cornish, was the first Black-owned and operated newspaper in the United States.

questions.question: Which law did Rosa Parks' bus boycott help lead to?
questions.explanation: The Montgomery Bus Boycott led to the Browder v. Gayle Supreme Court ruling that declared bus segregation unconstitutional.

questions.question: Who founded the Tuskegee Institute?
questions.explanation: Booker T. Washington founded the Tuskegee Institute (now Tuskegee University) in Alabama in 1881 as a school for Black students.

questions.question: What year was the NAACP founded?
questions.explanation: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) was founded in 1909 in response to the 1908 Springfield Race Riot.

questions.question: Who was the first Black American to earn a PhD from Harvard?
questions.explanation: W.E.B. Du Bois became the first Black American to earn a PhD from Harvard University in 1895.

questions.question: Which boxer refused to be drafted for the Vietnam War, citing religious beliefs?
questions.explanation: Muhammad Ali refused military service in 1967, was stripped of his boxing titles, and became an icon of resistance and principle.

questions.question: What was Juneteenth originally called?
questions.explanation: Juneteenth has been known by various names including Freedom Day, Jubilee Day, Liberation Day, and Emancipation Day.

questions.question: Who was the first Black person to serve in the U.S. Senate?
questions.explanation: Hiram Revels became the first Black U.S. Senator when he was elected to represent Mississippi in 1870.

questions.question: The phrase 'Black is Beautiful' became popular during which era?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'Black is Beautiful' became a widely-used affirmation during the Black Power movement of the 1960s and 1970s.

questions.question: Who invented the folding cabinet bed (precursor to the Murphy bed)?
questions.explanation: Sarah E. Goode became the first Black woman to receive a U.S. patent in 1885 for her folding cabinet bed design.
